   \let\origtableofcontents=\tableofcontents
   \def\tableofcontents{\@ifnextchar[{\origtableofcontents}{\gobbletableofcontents}}
   \def\gobbletableofcontents#1{\origtableofcontents}
 }
 \newenvironment{lyxcode}
   {\par\begin{list}{}{
     \setlength{\rightmargin}{\leftmargin}
     \setlength{\listparindent}{0pt}% needed for AMS classes
     \raggedright
     \setlength{\itemsep}{0pt}
     \setlength{\parsep}{0pt}
     \normalfont\ttfamily}%
    \def\{{\char`\{}
    \def\}{\char`\}}
    \def\textasciitilde{\char`\~}
    \item[]}
   {\end{list}}

\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}


\title[Lec1]{Lecture 1: Fundamentals of Matlab}

\author{Su, Danyang}

\date[July 2016]{ }

\makebeamertitle

%\pgfdeclareimage[height=0.5cm]{institution-logo}{institution-logo-filename}
%\logo{\pgfuseimage{institution-logo}}

\AtBeginSubsection[]{%
  \frame<beamer>{ 
    \frametitle{Outline}   
    \tableofcontents[currentsection,currentsubsection] 
  }
}

%\beamerdefaultoverlayspecification{<+->}
\begin{frame}{What Is Matlab:}

\begin{itemize}
\item High-level programing language: between C++ and Stata
\item Commonly used in numerical analysis, and visualization.
\item Data are stored as matrices (for the purpose of this course)
\item Learning by doing
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Pros:}

\begin{itemize}
\item Vectorization
\item Powerful toolbox (including visualization, and optimization.
\item Relatively low cost of learning. 
\item Flexible and consistent; good for DIY
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Cons:}

\begin{itemize}
\item Vectorization
\item Not fool-proof
\item Not fast enough
\item Not as specialized as Stata
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Types of files:}

\begin{itemize}
\item Scripts: executable scripts
\item Functions: called by scripts and other functions

\begin{itemize}
\item Example: 1 + sqrt(2)
\end{itemize}
\item Data: affix .mat, store variables in workspace (save)
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Interface:}

\begin{itemize}
\item Command window: for simple use
\item Text editors: create/edit .m file
\item Variable editors: display variables in \textbf{current} workspace
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{variables:}

\begin{itemize}
\item vectors

\begin{lyxcode}
x~=~zeros(5,2)~+~2{*}ones(5,2);~

\%matrix~size~must~matches.

y~=~zeros(4,1);~

\%always~preallocate~variables

y(1)~=~1;~y(2:3)~=~4;~y(4)~=~{[}{]};~y(5)~=~2==3;~

\%what~does~y~look~like?
\end{lyxcode}
\item Cells: a = cell(5); a\{1\} = `Name', a\{2\} = age;
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Basic Operations:}

\begin{itemize}
\item Scalar operators: (+ - {*} / \textasciicircum{})
\item Matrix operators: (.{*} ./ {*} / .\textasciicircum{} \textbackslash{})

\begin{itemize}
\item Quiz: How to express $X=(A)^{-1}B$?
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{If:}

\begin{itemize}
\item If arguments:

\begin{lyxcode}
if~a<b~

\begin{lyxcode}
a~=~1;
\end{lyxcode}
elseif~a==b~

\begin{lyxcode}
a~=~2;
\end{lyxcode}
else~

\begin{lyxcode}
a~=~3;
\end{lyxcode}
end
\end{lyxcode}
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Iterations:}

\begin{itemize}
\item For Loop:
\end{itemize}
\begin{lyxcode}
for~i=1:size(x,1)~

\begin{lyxcode}
for~j=1:size(x,2)~

\begin{lyxcode}
x(i,j)~=~(i-1){*}size(x,2)~+~j;
\end{lyxcode}
end
\end{lyxcode}
end
\end{lyxcode}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Iterations:}

\begin{itemize}
\item While loop:

\begin{lyxcode}
dist~=~1;~\%initial~value~must~not~satisfy~condition

x0~=~1

while~dist>0.01~\%don't~mess~up~the~sign~

\begin{lyxcode}
x\_new~=~0.9{*}x0~+~0.1{*}f(x0);

dist~=~abs(x\_new-x0);~\%remember~abs

x0~=~x\_new;~\%don't~mess~up~order
\end{lyxcode}
end
\end{lyxcode}
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Vectorization:}

\begin{itemize}
\item Try to vectorize whenever possible (mostly replace for loop):

\begin{lyxcode}
y~=~0;

for~i=1:4~

\begin{lyxcode}
y~=~y~+~x1(i)~+~x2(i);
\end{lyxcode}
end

y~=~x1{*}x2';
\end{lyxcode}
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Run Into Problem?:}

\begin{itemize}
\item use function \textbf{help}

\begin{lyxcode}
help~sum
\end{lyxcode}
\item Google search
\item Read documentation
\item Ask your friends/me
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Some Useful Commands:}

\begin{itemize}
\item clc: clear display
\item clear: clear variables
\item clear all: clear more than just variables.
\item Ctrl+c: stop ongoing execution 
\item A(:,1) : ``:'' stands for all
\item A(index,end-1): index is a vector of indexes or logics, ``end-1''
second to last column
\item C = {[}A B{]}; C={[}A;B{]}: append matrices 
\item kron(A,B): Kronecker product of A and B
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Some Useful Commands:}

\begin{itemize}
\item a<=b: a less than or equal to b
\item a\textasciitilde{}=b: a not equal to b
\item a \& b: and condition
\item a | b: or condition
\item \textasciitilde{}a: not condition
\item Comment/uncomment: \%
\item Section: \%\%
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Some Useful Commands:}

\begin{itemize}
\item eye(n): create identity matrix
\item diag(A): return diagonal of A
\item 1:2:8: {[}1 3 5 7{]}: create a matrix that starts with 1 with interval
2, up to 8. Note that 8 is not 
\item isempty(A): whether elements in A are empty? 

\begin{itemize}
\item Quiz: how to evaluate whether A is empty matrix?
\end{itemize}
\item isnan(A):whether elements in A are NaN
\item ans: display most recently unassigned evaluation
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Some Useful Commands:}

\begin{itemize}
\item log(A): element by element log of A
\item exp(A), sqrt(A), abs(A)
\item ceil(A): round towards +inf
\item floor(A): round toward -inf
\item round(A): round toward nearest integer
\item norm(A): norm of A
\item sum(A,d), min(A), max(A)
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}

\begin{frame}{Random Numbers:}

\begin{itemize}
\item rng(1)
\item rand(n,m)
\item randn(n,m)
\item randsample(population,k,true,w)
\item mvnrnd(mu,sigma)
\item Quiz: how to generate binomial distribution samples without using
mvnrnd?
\end{itemize}
\end{frame}


\end{document}
